newsitem.title: USA: Olympus cuts prices on storage drives.
newsitem.headline: Olympus cuts prices on storage drives.

text.p: Olympus America Inc, a unit of Japan's Olympus Optical Co Ltd, said on Tuesday that it cut its prices by $200 on its PowerMO 2600 line of optical drives.

The fastest optical storage drive available on the market, The PowerMO 2600 is a 5.25-inch 2.6 gigabyte rewritable optical solution that runs at 3600 rpm and transfers data at a rate of six megabytes per second, Olympus said.
Pricing for the PowerMO 2600/VAR is $1,769, PowerMO 2600/SCSI is $1,799, and the PowerMO 2600/SUN-SOL for the Sun Solaris computer is $2,099, the company said.
The optical drives are most commonly used in high-end graphic design, pre-press, document imaging, multimedia, and high-volume network applications, the company said.
